keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: We need a foreign policy argument to clarify which wars must be, or even can be, won.

headline.print_headline: A Case of Too Many Viennas
headline.main: A Case of Too Many Viennas

snippet: We need a foreign policy argument to clarify which wars must be, or even can be, won.
abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column submits that major challenge facing Pres Obama's successor will be deciding which of many overseas conflicts involving United States to try and win and which to merely contain; holds Republicans, frustrated by Obama's half-fought wars, are agitating for more aggressive involvement; warns America cannot fight aggressively on all fronts at once and sometimes containment, or lack of involvement, is best of bad option.
